003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.hal;
006
007@SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
008public class PowerDistributionFaults {
009  public final boolean Channel0BreakerFault;
010
011  public final boolean Channel1BreakerFault;
012
013  public final boolean Channel2BreakerFault;
014
015  public final boolean Channel3BreakerFault;
016
017  public final boolean Channel4BreakerFault;
018
019  public final boolean Channel5BreakerFault;
020
021  public final boolean Channel6BreakerFault;
022
023  public final boolean Channel7BreakerFault;
024
025  public final boolean Channel8BreakerFault;
026
027  public final boolean Channel9BreakerFault;
028
029  public final boolean Channel10BreakerFault;
030
031  public final boolean Channel11BreakerFault;
032
033  public final boolean Channel12BreakerFault;
034
035  public final boolean Channel13BreakerFault;
036
037  public final boolean Channel14BreakerFault;
038
039  public final boolean Channel15BreakerFault;
040
041  public final boolean Channel16BreakerFault;
042
043  public final boolean Channel17BreakerFault;
044
045  public final boolean Channel18BreakerFault;
046
047  public final boolean Channel19BreakerFault;
048
049  public final boolean Channel20BreakerFault;
050
051  public final boolean Channel21BreakerFault;
052
053  public final boolean Channel22BreakerFault;
054
055  public final boolean Channel23BreakerFault;
056
057  public final boolean Brownout;
058
059  public final boolean CanWarning;
060
061  public final boolean HardwareFault;
062
063  /**
064   * Gets whether there is a breaker fault at the specified channel.
065   *
066   * @param channel Channel to check for faults.
067   * @return True if there is a breaker fault at the channel, otherwise false.
068   * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the provided channel is outside of the range supported by
069   *     the hardware.
070   */
071  public final boolean getBreakerFault(int channel) {
072    return switch (channel) {
073      case 0 -> Channel0BreakerFault;
074      case 1 -> Channel1BreakerFault;
075      case 2 -> Channel2BreakerFault;
076      case 3 -> Channel3BreakerFault;
077      case 4 -> Channel4BreakerFault;
078      case 5 -> Channel5BreakerFault;
079      case 6 -> Channel6BreakerFault;
080      case 7 -> Channel7BreakerFault;
081      case 8 -> Channel8BreakerFault;
082      case 9 -> Channel9BreakerFault;
083      case 10 -> Channel10BreakerFault;
084      case 11 -> Channel11BreakerFault;
085      case 12 -> Channel12BreakerFault;
086      case 13 -> Channel13BreakerFault;
087      case 14 -> Channel14BreakerFault;
088      case 15 -> Channel15BreakerFault;
089      case 16 -> Channel16BreakerFault;
090      case 17 -> Channel17BreakerFault;
091      case 18 -> Channel18BreakerFault;
092      case 19 -> Channel19BreakerFault;
093      case 20 -> Channel20BreakerFault;
094      case 21 -> Channel21BreakerFault;
095      case 22 -> Channel22BreakerFault;
096      case 23 -> Channel23BreakerFault;
097      default -> throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
098          "Power distribution fault channel out of bounds!");
099    };
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Constructs from a bitfield.
104   *
105   * @param faults faults
106   */
107  public PowerDistributionFaults(int faults) {
108    Channel0BreakerFault = (faults & 0x1) != 0;
109    Channel1BreakerFault = (faults & 0x2) != 0;
110    Channel2BreakerFault = (faults & 0x4) != 0;
111    Channel3BreakerFault = (faults & 0x8) != 0;
112    Channel4BreakerFault = (faults & 0x10) != 0;
113    Channel5BreakerFault = (faults & 0x20) != 0;
114    Channel6BreakerFault = (faults & 0x40) != 0;
115    Channel7BreakerFault = (faults & 0x80) != 0;
116    Channel8BreakerFault = (faults & 0x100) != 0;
117    Channel9BreakerFault = (faults & 0x200) != 0;
118    Channel10BreakerFault = (faults & 0x400) != 0;
119    Channel11BreakerFault = (faults & 0x800) != 0;
120    Channel12BreakerFault = (faults & 0x1000) != 0;
121    Channel13BreakerFault = (faults & 0x2000) != 0;
122    Channel14BreakerFault = (faults & 0x4000) != 0;
123    Channel15BreakerFault = (faults & 0x8000) != 0;
124    Channel16BreakerFault = (faults & 0x10000) != 0;
125    Channel17BreakerFault = (faults & 0x20000) != 0;
126    Channel18BreakerFault = (faults & 0x40000) != 0;
127    Channel19BreakerFault = (faults & 0x80000) != 0;
128    Channel20BreakerFault = (faults & 0x100000) != 0;
129    Channel21BreakerFault = (faults & 0x200000) != 0;
130    Channel22BreakerFault = (faults & 0x400000) != 0;
131    Channel23BreakerFault = (faults & 0x800000) != 0;
132    Brownout = (faults & 0x1000000) != 0;
133    CanWarning = (faults & 0x2000000) != 0;
134    HardwareFault = (faults & 0x4000000) != 0;
135  }
136}
